720099f-a.folder: Grand Street & Ludlow Street, Manhattan, NY
720099f-a.text:
(1)
334 and 332 Grand Street, at and adjoining the N.W. corner of Ludlow Street. No. 334 (corner house) also faces on Ludlow Street.
April 7, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, at a later date, showing a more extensive view of the west side of Ludlow Street. Note the pineapple drinks vendor in the foreground at the N.W. corner.
April 25, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

732365f-a.folder: Grand Street and Ludlow Street, Manhattan, N.Y.
732365f-a.text:
Ladies hosiery displayed on cart, by peddler; on Grand Street, between Ludlow and Essex Streets.
May 8, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
732365f-a.title: Occupations - Peddlers - Clothing - Hosiery.

733299f-a.folder: Grand Street and Ludlow Street, Manhattan, N.Y.
733299f-a.text:
The bird of chance; prepared to foretell all in the future. Seen at Grand and Ludlow Streets, where it is still quite popular.
About 1923.
P. L. Sperr.
733299f-a.title: Street scenes - Fortune telling.
